message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.AI 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on maximizing the throughput of cognitive radio networks through the optimization of the sensing matrix used by secondary users. This topic falls under the domain of networking and internet architecture. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper deals with the optimization of the sensing matrix to maximize the network throughput, which involves the transmission and processing of information. This makes cs.IT a likely sub-category. 
3. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - Cognitive radio networks are vulnerable to security threats, and the paper may discuss the security implications of the proposed sensing matrix setting schemes. Hence, cs.CR is a possible sub-category. 
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The optimization problem formulated in the paper involves finding an optimal sensing matrix, which can be viewed as a control problem. Therefore, cs.SY is a possible sub-category. 
5. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) - The paper proposes three sub-optimal solutions for finding an appropriate sensing matrix, which may involve the use of machine learning or other AI techniques. Hence, cs.AI is a possible sub-category.
